peril.views.slick.board

Class SlickBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.views.slick.util.Viewable
      • peril.views.slick.util.Clickable
        • peril.views.slick.board.SlickBoard

  • public final class SlickBoard
extends Clickable
    The visual representation of the ModelBoard.
    Since:
    2018-03-15
    Version:
    1.01.04
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy, Gurdeep_Pol
    See Also:
    Clickable, ModelBoard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean lockedX
      Whether or not this SlickBoard is locked in the x direction when using move(Point, int, int).
      private boolean lockedY
      Whether or not this SlickBoard is locked in the y direction when using move(Point, int, int).
      ModelBoard model
      The ModelBoard that this SlickBoard displays to the user.
      private SlickModelView view
      The SlickModelView that is used to map the ModelBoard to the SlickBoard.

      • getCountry

        public SlickCountry getCountry(Point click)
        Retrieves a SlickCountry that is specified by the parameter Point.
        Parameters:
        click - The Point on the SlickBoard.
        Returns:
        The SlickCountry that was clicked if there was one.

      • move

        public Point move(Point vector,
                  int screenWidth,
                  int screenHeight)
        Moves this SlickBoard and all its components along a specified Point vector. If the SlickBoard is at a boundary and this method is called it will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        vector - The Point vector that the SlickBoard will be moved.
        screenWidth - The width of the screen.
        screenHeight - The height of the screen.
        Returns:
        The Point vector that the SlickBoard moved.

      • moveComponents

        private void moveComponents(Point vector)
        Moves all the SlickContinents and SlickCountrys on this SlickBoard by the specified Point vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The Point that the SlickBoard was moved by.

      • getValidVector

        private int getValidVector(int vector,
                           int current,
                           int lowerBound,
                           int upperBound)
        Retrieves the a valid single dimension vector based on whether the specifed vector will hit a boundary or not. If the specified vector will move the board outside of the specified boundaries. The vector returned will be such that this will not happen.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector of to move the board in. + or -
        current - The current position of the board within the boundaries.
        lowerBound - The value of the lower boundary.
        upperBound - The value of the upper boundary.
        Returns:
        The valid vector.
